attributes.name: ai_familiarity
attributes.description: Self-reported familiarity with AI technology and concepts (None, Basic, Intermediate, Advanced, Expert).

attributes.name: works_in_tech
attributes.description: Whether the person works in a technology-related field or industry.

attributes.name: prior_asi_belief
attributes.description: Pre-announcement belief about the timeline for ASI: whether the person thought ASI was imminent, decades away, never, or had no opinion.

attributes.name: ai_safety_concern_level
attributes.description: Degree of pre-existing concern about AI safety and existential risk from AI systems (0–1 scale, 0 = unconcerned, 1 = highly concerned).

attributes.name: openai_trust
attributes.description: Level of trust in OpenAI as a company and its stated safety claims prior to the announcement (0–1 scale).

attributes.name: tech_optimism
attributes.description: General optimism that technology and innovation improve society and human wellbeing (0–1 scale).

attributes.name: job_displacement_concern
attributes.description: Degree to which the person fears AI will displace their job or economic opportunities (0–1 scale).

attributes.name: initial_asi_reaction
attributes.description: Initial emotional reaction upon hearing the ASI announcement (Excited, Fearful, Skeptical, Indifferent, Mixed).

attributes.name: sci_fi_consumption
attributes.description: Frequency of consuming science fiction media (books, films, TV) featuring AI or superintelligence themes (Never, Rarely, Sometimes, Often, Very Often).

attributes.name: social_network_tech_density
attributes.description: Proportion of close social contacts (friends, family, colleagues) who work in or closely follow the technology sector (0–1 scale).

attributes.name: opinion_volatility
attributes.description: Tendency to update or shift opinions after social discussion and exposure to new information (0–1 scale, 0 = very stable, 1 = highly volatile).

attributes.name: doomism_tendency
attributes.description: Predisposition toward catastrophic or worst-case interpretations of transformative technological events (0–1 scale).

input.notes: Big Five traits already exist in the base population (openness, conscientiousness, extraversion, agreeableness, neuroticism) — not rediscovered here. Focus is on ASI-announcement-specific reaction att...[truncated]
